clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Indicated to reduce viscosity in the blood before transfusions

contraindications.disease: In an acute oral toxicity study in rat the LD50 was 9380 mg kg MSDS P188 has been demonstrated to be safe when given for up to 72 hours A27217
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Poloxamer 188 P188 exerts a protective action against oxidative stress and inflammation in tissue injury in various experimental models In the rat model of excitotoxic injury immediate intrathecal administration of P188 reduced neuronal loss indicated by smaller spherical excitotoxic lesions A33124 In a murine hind limb model P188 mediated a protective action against ischemia reperfusion injury as indicated by decreased myocyte injury preserved tissue adenosine 5 triphosphate levels and improved survival rates suggesting that P188 can seal defects in cell membranes and attenuate damage induced by reactive oxygen species A33122 P188 was shown to elicit protective effects against excitotoxic injury and trauma induced necrotic and apoptotic cell death in cultured neurons A27218 In the mouse stroke models P188 exerted a neuroprotective effect in brain ischemia reperfusion induced acute injury by significantly reducing infarct volume and water content in brain edema and ameliorating the neurological symptoms 24 h after ischemia or reperfusion injury A27218 P188 also significantly inhibited inflammatory coagulation and apoptotic responses resulting from superior mesenteric artery occlusion A33121 In the experimental model of striatum injury in rats P188 was shown to reduce excitotoxicity induced tissue loss and macrophage infiltrate A33119
